decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It includes efficient mana ramp with Expedition Map and the Urza lands, enabling early plays of big threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and access to powerful artifacts like Walking Ballista and Ugin, the Ineffable. The deck also includes removal options like Dismember and Warping Wail to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the board and pressure the opponent quickly. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions help with card advantage and consistency, while cards like Temur Battle Rage can help push through damage and finish off the opponent. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, making use of its graveyard and life total as valuable resources to secure victory.

This deck aims to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate large amounts of mana early on. It utilizes powerful cards like Karn Liberated, Karn, the Great Creator, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game. With tutors like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying, and versatile removal in Oblivion Stone and Blast Zone, this deck aims to control the game and win with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and synergy between Urza, Lord High Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to control the game. It includes key cards like Mox Opal, Gilded Goose, and Oko, Thief of Crowns to generate resources and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also uses Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo for additional value and uses Whir of Invention to tutor for crucial pieces. With access to counterspells like Cryptic Command and Engineered Explosives, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a grindy control game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly lower your own life total to make Death's Shadow as powerful as possible, while also using efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption cards to control the game. Additionally, the deck utilizes Tarmogoyf as a powerful threat and Traverse the Ulvenwald to find key cards when needed. The inclusion of Temur Battle Rage allows for explosive turns and potential quick kills, making this deck a dangerous and aggressive force in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on disruption, removal, and control, utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the board. It also makes use of snow lands and cards like Dead of Winter and Ice-Fang Coatl for additional value. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board, and eventually win through attrition or by leveraging the advantage gained from the control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and play multiple lands per turn, allowing for quick ramping into Primeval Titan. With cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout, the deck can easily search for and play lands to trigger the Titan's ability and quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. The inclusion of utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Cavern of Souls adds versatility to the strategy, making it a potent combo deck in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently, using cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Reality Smasher to put pressure on the opponent. Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer disrupt the opponent's game plan while Eldrazi Temple and Urza's lands provide the necessary mana to cast the creatures. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust to deal with threats. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and disruptive spells, aiming to win the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to gain control of the game through various means such as countering spells, bouncing threats, and creating advantages through artifacts like Urza, Lord High Artificer. It utilizes a combination of powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble. The deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent with its versatile card choices and synergies between cards like Cryptic Command and Urza's ability.

The main concept of this deck is to create a game-winning combo by using cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Pestermite or Brineborn Cutthroat to create copies of the combo piece, allowing for infinite creature generated and direct damage to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Cryptic Command and Remand for control, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt for removal or finishing off the opponent. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for increased flexibility and reusing key spells from the graveyard. The mana base is also carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for the combo.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and disrupting the opponent with tempo plays. By using cards like Spreading Seas to disrupt the opponent's mana base and Merfolk Trickster to tap down threats, it aims to control the game while applying pressure with powerful lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while Force of Negation provides protection against opposing spells. The deck's synergy and speed make it a formidable aggro deck in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of powerful human creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat out creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage. The key strategy is to build up a wide board presence and buff them with cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to deal massive damage before the opponent can stabilize. The deck is able to apply pressure early on and close out games quickly.

The deck is focused on aggressive gameplay through a combination of efficient creature threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board. Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek disrupt opponents' strategies, while planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six provide additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on using the combo of Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian, while also using Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The deck also contains powerful control elements like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and counterspells like Force of Negation and Spell Pierce. The deck's mana base includes a variety of lands to support its three-color mana requirements, along with cards like Arcum's Astrolabe for color fixing. The main goal is to assemble the combo pieces while controlling the opponent's board and resources.

The deck focuses on aggressively deploying powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's resources. The deck's strategy is further enhanced by utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald to dig for key pieces and maintain consistent pressure. Additionally, cards like Stubborn Denial and Drown in the Loch provide protection and interaction against opposing threats. The deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently through a combination of efficient threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw multiple cards and gain card advantage, while controlling the game with a variety of removal spells and counterspells. Additionally, the deck includes a toolbox of multicolored spells to search for with Bring to Light, providing flexibility in different matchups and situations. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolored spells and ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal, while leveraging Niv-Mizzet Reborn's powerful effect to swing the game in its favor.

This deck focuses on aggressive burn spells and efficient creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to constantly apply pressure with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using direct damage spells like Lava Spike, Boros Charm, and Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Leyline of Combustion and Skullcrack help to disrupt the opponent's defense or prevent life gain. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for fast and aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing their own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, while using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Thought Scour to recycle key spells and maintain card advantage. Furthermore, the inclusion of cards like Temur Battle Rage and Drown in the Loch allows for explosive finishes or versatile answers to threats. Mishra's Bauble is also included for additional card selection and triggering Death's Shadow's ability.

This deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive plays. The deck includes mana-fixing lands, ramp creatures like Noble Hierarch and Boreal Druid, and disruptive spells such as Path to Exile and Thought-Knot Seer. The Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Drowner of Hope provide powerful threats that can quickly close out games. The deck also includes some versatile cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Engineered Explosives to deal with a variety of threats. By combining speed, disruption, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize.
